post: At the inaugural Debate & Leadership Institute cohosted with Founding Forward, 48 high school students from 17 states came together at Valley Forge to strengthen their debate skills, study civic responsibility, and walk in the footsteps of Americas founders. From tackling questions about the balance of power in government to discussing On Liberty, students left with the tools to engage in civil discourse and lead in their communities. How can we better prepare young people to disagree well and lead with integrity? Wed love to hear your thoughts. 🔗 Read more:  https://bit.ly/47OenRx  #CivicEducation  #Debate  #LeadershipDevelopment  #CivilDiscourse

Were thankful to Speak for Yourself for their support of our Civics for Everyone initiative. Speak for Yourself is an organization helping non-speaking students engage in meaningful civic dialogue using accessible AAC technology. Learn how you can support our Civics for Everyone initiative:  https://bit.ly/4jBYuQp  #CivicsForEveryone  #EdEquity  #AAC  #Inclusion  #StudentVoice

Were proud to announce the 10 finalists for the Bill of Rights Institutes National Civics Teacher of the Year Award! These educators inspire students to understand our nations history and their rights & responsibilities as citizens. Thanks to FileWave for sponsoring this years award. 🔗  https://bit.ly/464FiqY  #CivicEducation  #CivicTeachers  #TeacherRecognition  #EdChat

#OTD, 250 years ago, King George III declared the American colonies to be in a state of rebellion. Read the text of the Kings proclamation and ask yourself, what was the significance of this moment, and why does this moment still matter to our national story? Discover more:  https://bit.ly/47Isxnc  #TDiH  #BRI250  #  #AmericanRevolution  #CivicIdentity

Why did colonists finally declare independence? Use this video for Middle School students to analyze key texts about the Stamp Act, Declaratory Act, and Declaration of Independence. Along the way, students will uncover how debates over self-governance sparked a revolution, all while practicing essential skills for grouping primary sources. 🎥 Watch now:  https://bit.ly/45JszbV  #CivicEducation  #MiddleSchoolHistory  #AmericanRevolution  #SocialStudies
